game

Class GameWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameWindow

  • public class GameWindow
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameWindow creates the window, and creates the level panel.
    Version:
    1.0, May 21 2014. (creates game window), 1.1, May 22 2014. (added keyboard listener, instantiates vs extends JFrame), 1.2, May 26 2014. (Coded keyboard listener, modified window listener.), 1.3, May 27 2014. (bug fix with up key, added closeWindow method), 1.4, May 28 2014. (Added side and pause panels (for every level). Medium game also shows up!), 1.5, May 30 2014. (Changed access level of paused to public static, added frame and its accessor method. Added argument to constructor param list.), 1.6, May 31 2014. (Added difficult level), 1.7, June 4 2014. (Added keyReleased = for shooting, to eliminate player shooting randomly, win, loseFocus and changeScreen methods), 1.8, June 5 2014. (JavaDoc), 1.9, June 6 2014. (Added username prompt to create score record.), 2.0, June 8 2014. (Added getLevel method, modified key listener implementation to prevent program crashes. Added getMap and option to not save scores.), 2.1, June 10 2014. (JavaDoc)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu, Chusa Nguyen, baseball435 of Youtube(ScreenFactory class)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameWindow

        public GameWindow(java.lang.String description,
          int level,
          MenuFrames frame)
        The class constructor. It sets the window's title and the appropriate panels. A 900 by 600 pixel window is created. A KeyListener is added to get user input. The appropriate LevelScreen is added and displayed. A new panel is added to update the game. SidePanel and PausePanel are added as well. This also creates two anonymous classes, one that extends WindowAdapter, and the other that extends KeyboardListener. The first allows a window to pop up to verify if the user wants to close when the user presses the close button and the second stores the keys pressed and released when the user presses anything on the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        description - String - Describes the current game level.
        level - int - Represents the current level difficulty.
        frame - MenuFrames - The current instance of MenuFrames is passed through to give this class access to it.
        event - - KeyEvent - The KeyEvent object.
        screen - - LevelScreen - Stores the level screen to be displayed.

    • Method Detail

      • win

        public void win(int level)
        Shows the win screen for the level specified in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        level - - int - The level that has been won.

      • loseFocus

        public void loseFocus()
        Requests that the side panel be in focus.

      • changeScreen

        public void changeScreen(int level)
        Sets the current screen to another LevelScreen depending on the level as specified in the parameter. Changes the launcher icon as well.
        Parameters:
        level - - int - The level to show.
        screen - - LevelScreen - The new screen.
        points - - int - The user's points to transfer.

      • closeWindow

        public void closeWindow()
        The "closeWindow" method, which disposes of the current instance of GameWindow and brings the current game to a stop.

        private void verifyClose()
        The "verifyClose" method, which confirms whether or not the user wishes to leave the game before exiting the program.
        Parameters:
        choice - int - Represents the user's choice.

      • askName

        protected boolean askName()
        The "askName" method, which prompts the user to input their name before returning to the main menu. The while loop is used to repeatedly prompt for input until an acceptable name has been given.
        Parameters:
        username - String - Stores the user's name.
        level - String - String representation of the current game level.
        choice - int - Represents whether or not the user would like to save their score.
        Returns:
        Returns false if the user chooses to cancel (not return to main menu), true if an acceptable name is entered.

      • getLevel

        protected int getLevel()
        The "getLevel" method, which returns the current level of the game being played.
        Returns:
        Returns the numeric representation of the game's level.

      • getMap

        protected LevelMap getMap()
        The "getMap" method, which returns the current instance of the LevelMap which was created.
        Returns:
        Returns the current LevelMap instance.
